data.title: Teller, Edward, 1908
data.text:
Edward Teller

Dates

January 15, 1908 – September 9, 2003

Authorized Form of Name

Teller, Edward, 1908-2003

Additional Forms of Names

Teller, Ede, 1908-2003

Teller, Edward

Teller, Edward, 1908-

Biography

Abstract

Received Ph.D. in physics from the University of Leipzig in 1930. Professor of Physics, George Washington University, 1935-41; employed on the Manhattan Project, 1942-46; Professor of Physics, University of Chicago, 1946-52; Assistant Director, Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory, 1949-52; Associate Director and Director, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, 1954-1960; Professor of Physics and Emeritus Professor of Physics, University of California, Berkeley, 1953-2003; Professor and Senior Research Fellow, Hoover Institution, Stanford University, 1960-2003. Retired in 1975.

January 15, 1908Birth, Budapest (Hungary).

1929 – 1931Research Associate, University of Leipzig.

1930Received Ph.D. in physics, University of Leipzig, Leipzig (Germany).

1931 – 1933Research Associate, University of Göttingen.

1933 – 1934Rockefeller Fellow, Institute for Theoretical Physics, Copenhagen.

1934Lecturer, London City College.

1935 – 1941Professor of Physics, George Washington University, Washington (D.C.).

1941 – 1942Researcher, Columbia University.

1942 – 1946Researcher, Chicago Metallurgical Laboratory (1942-1943); Leader of Hydrodynamics of Implosion and Super Theory Group (1943-1944) and Leader of General and Super Theory Group (1944-1946), Los Alamos Laboratory, Manhattan Project.

1946 – 1952Professor of Physics, University of Chicago, Chicago (Ill.).

1948Member, National Academy of Sciences.

1949 – 1952Assistant Director, Los Alamos National Laboratory.

1952 – 1960Consultant (1952-1953); Associate Director (1954-1958); and Director (1958-1960), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Livermore (Calif.).

1953 – 2003Professor of Physics (1953-1975) and Emeritus Professor of Physics (1975-2003), University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley (Calif.).

1956 – 1958Member, General Advisory Committee, U.S. Atomic Energy Commission.

1960 – 2003Professor (1960-1975) and Senior Research Fellow (1975-2003), Hoover Institution on War Revolution and Peace, Stanford University, Stanford (Calif.).

1962Received Enrico Fermi Award, U.S. Atomic Energy Commission.

1982Received National Medal of Science.

1994Received Middle Cross with the Star of the Order of Merit of the Republic of Hungary.

September 9, 2003Death, Palo Alto (Calif.).

Occupation

Nuclear and quantum physicist.

People

Family

Teller, Augusta Harkanyi

Wife, married in 1934.

Teller, Emmi

Sister.

Mother.

Teller, Max

Father.

Teller, Paul, 1943-

Son.

Teller, Wendy

Daughter. Co-wrote "Conversation on the Dark Secrets of Physics."

Advisors & Collaborators

Gamow, George, 1904-1968

Collaborated on the Gamow-Teller theory of weak interactions. Both employed at George Washington University.

Heisenberg, Werner, 1901-1976

PhD advisor at University of Leipzig (Universität Leipzig) on the hydrogen molecular ion.

Latter, Albert L.

Co-wrote "Ausblick in das Kernzeitalter."

Rice, F. O. (Francis Owen), 1890-

Co-wrote "The Structure of Matter."

Rosenbluth, M. N.

Advised by Teller at University of Chicago, "Electromagnetic interactions of a vector meson with a scalar excited state," and both employed at Los Alamos Laboratory.

Sachs, Robert Green, 1916-

Advised by Teller at Johns Hopkins University.

Talley, Wilson

Co-wrote "Conversations on the Dark Secrets of Physics."

Ulam, Stanislaw M.

Collaborated on the Teller-Ulam design for thermonuclear weapons which led to the development of the hydrogen bomb. Both employed at Los Alamos Laboratory, Manhattan Project.

Wolfenstein, L. (Lincoln)

Advised by Teller at University of Chicago, "Theory of proposed reactions involving polarized protons."

Yang, Chen Ning, 1922-

Advised by Teller at University of Chicago, "On the angular distribution in nuclear reactions and coincidence measurements," and both employed at University of Chicago.
